## External Auditor Services

### Request for Proposal (RFP)

The Workers Compensation Board of Manitoba (WCB) invites external audit firms to submit proposals for the provision of external audit services.

### Background

The WCB requires an independent auditor to perform attest audits of its financial statements and WCB retirement plan financial statements in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) and Canadian generally accepted auditing standards.

### Scope of Work

The selected audit firm will be responsible for performing the following services:

• Attest audit of the WCB's financial statements
• Attest audit of the WCB Retirement Plan's financial statements
• Auditors' report on the WCB's Compensation Disclosure Report
• Auditors' report on the Specified Procedures Report (SPR)

### Proposal Requirements

Proposals must include the following information:

• A title page with the RFP subject, vendor's firm name, local address, contact person, and telephone number
• A table of contents clearly identifying the material by section and page number
• A letter of introduction with the authorized representative's name, address, and telephone number
• A profile of the vendor, including its experience and expertise in workers' compensation and insurance industry audit and consulting
• A summary of the vendor's qualifications, including brief resumes for each staff member involved in the audit
• An audit approach, including a detailed description of the tools/software used to perform the audit
• Additional data, including the physical location of servers and security/privacy protocols in place

### Evaluation Criteria

Proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

• Extent and quality of the vendor's related audit experience
• IFRS 17 experience, specifically in the context of workers' compensation
• Specific experience of the vendor's staff to be assigned to the engagement
• Quality and appropriateness of the vendor's proposed work plan and assigned personnel
• Ability to meet the timing of the audit work and reporting deadlines
• Technical specifications and description of the tools/software used to perform the audit
• Cost based on best value
• Adherence to the terms of this RFP

### Contract Terms

The WCB expects to enter into a five-year engagement with the selected audit firm, with work commencing as soon as practicable upon execution of the agreement. Short-listed vendors will be required to attend interviews between August 20 and August 23, 2024.
